metadata.synopsis: Conclusion of the romance line with Astarion.Different flows depending on what happened to him:1. If he became a vampire lord.2. if he decided to stay a vampire spawn.3. if you killed Cazador without him.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - CompanionAstarion - Relationship - Start relationshipAstarion - Tepeort Act 3 (Lower City) (if not already in Lower City)Astarion - Act 3 (Lower City) - Queue night (Astarion is vampire lord)or Astarion - Act 3 (Lower City) - Queue night (Astarion is vampire spawn)or Astarion - Act 3 (Lower City) - Queue night (Killed Cazador without Astarion)Agreed to go to the camp. Click on the bed.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: I can't believe you let me do that. Killing all those people.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I wanted what was best for you.

262.speaker: Astarion
262.text: You sweet, sweet thing. I want what's best for you too, of course.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: I wasn't about to release seven thousand hungry vampire spawn into the world.

257.speaker: Astarion
257.text: Of course, whatever you need to tell yourself, darling.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: But make no mistake, I will forever remember what you did for me today.

197.speaker: Astarion
197.text: And one wicked turn deserves another.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: So, tell me what you desire. What can I do for my dearest pet?

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I want to be a vampire, like you.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I want you. I want your body.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: You can tell me that you've learned something from all this.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: Oh don't be such a humourless little wretch - it's nothing but a joke.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: It doesn't feel like a joke. It feels like you mean it.

203.speaker: Astarion
203.text: Life's a joke, dear, but now we're the ones laughing.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: You haven't learned anything, have you?

163.speaker: Astarion
163.text: Truly? And what was I supposed to learn from this?

229.speaker: Player
229.text: I hoped you'd learn to love me.

121.speaker: Astarion
121.text: Who's to say I don't? I'm willing to share all of this with you. What's that if not love?

269.speaker: Astarion
269.text: Of course if that's not enough - if you need something more - perhaps this isn't for you?

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: Don't you ever compare me to him! Never!

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: How dare you stand there and judge me. As you know the first thing.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: That sex and relationships aren't about power over someone else.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Please, everything is about power. Sex, relationships, violence - they're all just different forms of control.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: And now you think you can stand there and tell me how to feel? Because - what? Because you care?

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: Your hands are bloody as mine, darling. Why would you go along with any of this just to pretend you're innocent now?

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I wanted you to feel safe.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Because I cared! But maybe now I see how wrong I was.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I did it for you, you piece of shit.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: All right. But if your offer is still open, I want to be a vampire. Just like you.

158.speaker: Astarion
158.text: Oh my sweet, there are no vampires like me. And there never will be again.

174.speaker: Astarion
174.text: But if you want the gift of eternity, I can certainly offer you that. One little bite is all it would take.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: It would mean your salvation. Your eternity, despite that thing inside you.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: That's what you want, isn't it? To be mine? Forever?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Would you be able to bite me without getting hurt?

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: Karlach, my love. I'm the Vampire Ascendant - there's nothing I can't do.
127.context: NodeContext: Hubris. If he does bite her, he's going to die.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: So what would I be? A vampire? Or your spawn?

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: You wouldn't just be some spawn - you're far more than that to me.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: My dark consort. My right hand. My most beloved spawn.

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: Then it's everything you shall recieve.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: I will miss this warm flesh, mind you.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Spawn? I want to be a true vampire.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: And you will! All in good time.

82.speaker: Astarion
82.text: But we mustn't rush these things. You may need time to adjust.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: A beloved slave is still a slave.

239.speaker: Astarion
239.text: Oh don't be like that, I'd never want to control you. I love you.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: After everything you went through with Cazador, you're going to make me a spawn?

204.speaker: Astarion
204.text: Oh that was completely different, I'd never hurt you. I love you.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: That's what you've been waiting to hear, isn't it? That's what you want?

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: We could be together for eternity, ruling this world side by side. We could have it all.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I'm not sure. I'm burning so hot. I'm afraid of what will happen to you.

224.speaker: Astarion
224.text: You haven't seen my power, darling. You don't know the things I can do.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: I am indomitable, Karlach. Nothing can stop me - least of all your hot-blooded self.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I'm ready. Bite me. Make me yours. Fix me.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: I have been waiting so long for you.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Shall we have one last night together before you join me in immortality? One for the road, so to speak.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: We shall not. I just need you to bite me.

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: Impatient are we? Well who am I to deny you?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Huh. I forgot I'd be cold to the touch once I changed...

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: Not having second thoughts, are we?

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Then come with me, my love, and live your final night.

18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion leads Tav away to a secluded place. You both undress and Astarion pushes Tav to the bed. The sex is wild and animalistic. (Note: While the sex isn't super explicit, it's important to show suggestions of movements...such as thrusting, action/reactions of ecstasy, etc.)

171.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black and fade in as Astarion takes TAV into another section of the camp/a quiet secluded place. You are naked and vulnerable before him.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Be careful, Astarion. My engine is running so hot. I won't be able to control it.

211.speaker: Astarion
211.text: Hush love, it's all right. You don't have to worry.

244.speaker: Astarion
244.text: Forget about your engine. Forget about control. I'll take care of everything.
244.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure Karlach, while thinking of how he's going to have control of her soon

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Explore his mind - see what he really thinks about you.

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *He will always see you as degrading yourself if you continue to be with him.*

238.speaker: Narrator
238.text: *But perhaps you wish to degrade yourself. And he knows it.*

281.speaker: Astarion
281.text: You're missing the chance of a lifetime. You will never have another like me.
281.context: NodeContext: Ego shattering a little bit

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: It won't take me until the end of time to find another like you.

210.speaker: Astarion
210.text: Tonight, I shall drink every drop of your blood.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Own your body, kill your mind.

137.speaker: Astarion
137.text: It will only hurt a bit, the pleasure will be far greater than the pain.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: He pushes you down to the ground, gets on top of you.

68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion takes your hand, kisses the top of it, then turns it over and starts to bite your wrist.

125.speaker: Astarion
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion goes on fire after drinking Karlach's blood.NodeContext: Bit Karlach, got a mouthful of hot blood, caught fire

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: How dare you! How could you? I was trying to help you, but you're beyond help.
126.context: NodeContext: Hubris here. He can't actually fix or hurt Karlach, but he's pretending he can.

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: Get away from me - get out of my sight!

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: You have given me everything. Thank you.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *As he drinks more and more, you feel yourself fading from consciousness. When you wake again, you will be his forever more.*
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion lowers his head to feast again.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Oh, come on. Let it hurt.

111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion clutches your neck in his hand and grins, squeezing before biting you.

212.speaker: Astarion
212.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player makes as if going to kneel and then knees him in the balls. (Note: What.The.Heck?)

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: To hells with you, I'm done. I hope you rot.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: Astarion straightens up from pained crouch, and storms off after saying this line)

209.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion leads Tav away to a secluded place. You both undress and Astarion pushes Tav to the bed. The sex is wild and animalistic. (Note: While the sex isn't super explicit, it's important to show suggestions of movements...such as thrusting, action/reactions of ecstasy, etc.)

185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion leads Tav away to a secluded place. You both undress and Astarion pushes Tav to the bed. The sex is wild and animalistic. (Note: While the sex isn't super explicit, it's important to show suggestions of movements...such as thrusting, action/reactions of ecstasy, etc.)

65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion leads Tav away to a secluded place. You both undress and Astarion pushes Tav to the bed. The sex is wild and animalistic. (Note: While the sex isn't super explicit, it's important to show suggestions of movements...such as thrusting, action/reactions of ecstasy, etc.)

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I don't want this after all.

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: It seems I misjudged you. I thought we might have a future together - even an eternity - but perhaps you're not worthy.

81.speaker: Astarion
81.text: So. What's it to be, darling? Is this it?

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I hope we can work things out and stay together.

157.speaker: Astarion
157.text: Of course we can. You're the one that I want - the one that I love.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: And you could be so much more, if you want it. One little bite and you could be mine forever.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I still care for you, but it can't be like this.

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: A pity, then. We could have had something truly special.

162.speaker: Astarion
162.text: I won't forget what you've done for me. I won't leave you to fight this alone.

232.speaker: Astarion
232.text: You came so far, only to slip now. Such a pity.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're a hypocrite, and I don't want to be with you.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: There you are. The real you shows themselves at last.

275.speaker: Astarion
275.text: We are bound until the end, you and I. But there will be an end.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: Until then, you can enjoy my company. You can benefit from my power. But you will not be in my heart.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: I don't want to look at you again. Get out of my camp.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Good luck with the brain, darling.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Sounds like you'd have it all.

261.speaker: Astarion
261.text: I already have everything. Except you by my side.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Are you ready to join me? To accept this immortal gift?

164.speaker: Player
164.text: No, this isn't what I want.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: What if I don't want forever?

192.speaker: Astarion
192.text: What's not to want? We could be together for all time.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I wanted a good time, that's all.

225.speaker: Astarion
225.text: What do you mean? Think of the things I can offer you! You're not going to say no to that, surely?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I wanted you to be free. It seems you never will be.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: But if you want the gift of eternity, I can give you that. One more bite is all it would take.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Then stop joking around and let's sleep together.

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: But don't you want more - don't you want eternity? One more bite is all it would take?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I don't feel great about it, honestly.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Well, what's done is done. And there's simply no point in dwelling on the past, is there?

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: No, you have given me a glorious new future.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I wanted a powerful ally. And now I have one.

181.speaker: Astarion
181.text: Indeed you do. I am so very, very powerful - all thanks to you.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: I should probably start getting used to the shadows again. Who knows how long I have left in the sun?

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Don't say that - we could still find a way to control the tadpole.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: Maybe, but even if I could control it, it's a dangerous game.

285.speaker: Astarion
285.text: I'd spend every day waiting for something to go wrong. For the tadpole to find some new trick, reassert itself, and make me a slave again.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You did the right thing, stopping the Black Mass.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: I know. That doesn't mean it stings any less.

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: No, I made the right choice. Although I do regret the options I had.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I'm surprised you didn't go through with the ritual. I was sure you were a power-hungry madman.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: I'm glad I still have the power to surprise you. Even if it's the only power I have left.

282.speaker: Astarion
282.text: Maybe never seeing the sun again is just the price of freedom.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'll be with you either way. I hope you know that.

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: Assuming we survive, of course. Because a horrible death is always just around the corner with you.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: And if it is? Can you live with that?

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: I'll have to. But that doesn't mean I have to like it.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: There's... something I'd like to show you, if that's all right? Something out in the city.

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *The graveyard is appropriately silent - there isn't a proverbial soul around.*
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the graveyard to set the scene. (Question: Do we need to show actual graveyard, or just Astarion and Player emerging from bushes somewhere?)

154.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarion walks up to a gravestone covered in ivy and filth. It's old, cracked, and neglected. He reaches up and tears away the weeds. Underneath, we can see the inscription: 
|Astarion Ancunín: 229 - 268 DR| (Note: Needs old gravestone prop with his name. Possible to use ivy plant to cover prop? How tall is gravestone? Does Astarion need to squat/crouch down or bend over to interact with gravestone?)

249.speaker: Astarion
249.text: Nearly two hundred years and I never came back. Not since the night I woke up down there.

132.speaker: Astarion
132.text: I had to punch a hole in the coffin and claw my way through six feet of dirt.

237.speaker: Astarion
237.text: Then when I finally broke the surface, retching up dirt and congealed blood, Cazador was waiting.

206.speaker: Astarion
206.text: From that day on I was his. Until today.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: You were never his. Whatever he had, he took by force.

187.speaker: Astarion
187.text: Maybe, but he did take it. There's almost nothing left of the person I was. Just a name on a rock.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: How does it feel to be free?

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: For nearly two centuries I stalked the streets like a ghost while the person I was lay here, dead and buried.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: Now I need to figure out who I am. What I want.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: You're the person I love. The person I want.

241.speaker: Astarion
241.text: You were by my side through all of this. Through bloodlust and pain and misery. You were patient. You cared. You trusted me when that was an objectively stupid thing to do.

194.speaker: Astarion
194.text: I feel safe with you. Seen. And whatever the future holds for me, I don't want to lose that.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: You won't. Whatever comes next, I've got you.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Well. I should probably fix this.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the inscription on his grave

265.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion takes out Cazador's dagger and starts carving into the stone, although we can't see what he's carving. When he's done, the camera angle reverses and we see he's roughly cut a new inscription into the stone. Below his date of birth is a new date - the current year. The inscription now reads |Astarion Ancunín: 229 - 268 DR  468 DR -

22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion sits back, looking at his gravestone, saying nothing. He's in a moment of deep reflection. (Note:Astarion is still kneeling down)

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Hold back. Give him his moment.

114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion stares at his grave, quietly contemplating his life/unlife (Note:Astarion is still kneeling down)

19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player kneels next to Astarion (Note:Astarion is still kneeling down. Player starts with standing, then kneels down)

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: I've been dead in the ground for long enough. It's time to try living again.

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: With everything that life has to offer.
179.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to the player, but doesn't touch player's handt. (Note: Both Astarion and Player are kneeling)

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'd love to be closer to you, Astarion, but until my heart is fixed, it's too dangerous.

221.speaker: Astarion
221.text: And here I thought I was the dangerous one. But I'm not so frightening after all, am I?

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: That's... interesting. I might even say I like it. And as for you and me, well, I'm willing to wait.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: What did you have in mind?

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: A great deal. But nothing I can act on without burning to a crisp. But I'm willing to wait.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: With everything that life has to offer.
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to the player, taking their hands in his for a moment. (Note: Both Astarion and Player are kneeling)NodeContext: Slightly horny. (ONLY SLIGHTLY, NEIL)

287.speaker: Astarion
287.text: If a night of passion is on offer, I could be persuaded.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: You know, I didn't care for you when we first met.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Note: Astarion releases Player's hands. They're still kneeling facing each other)

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: But I do now. Being with you is about more than lust or manipulating you into a tactical alliance.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: I love you. I love this. And I want it all.

216.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion kisses the player, taking them in his arms. They fall to the ground. Kissing continues.

165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black. Sex sounds. (Note: Maybe camera pans up before fading to black with the dulcet symphony of sex)

267.speaker: Player
267.text: I think I need a little time, honestly.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: We don't have to rush into anything tonight.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Note: Astarion releases Player's hands. They're still kneeling facing each other)

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: We might not have forever, but we do have all the time we need.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Unless we die horribly tomorrow. Which is always a strong possibility.

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: Come on, let's get back to the camp. Who knows how long before the others go feral without us there to guide them?
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: Astarion gets to his feet from kneeling position, followed by Player

280.speaker: Astarion
280.text: Come on, let's get back to the camp. If a night of passion isn't on the cards, a night of rest would be very, very welcome.
280.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note: Astarion gets to his feet, followed by Player

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Oh? Do you want a little fun?

226.speaker: Astarion
226.text: I guess that depends on what your idea of 'a little fun' is.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Of course. That... that would mean a lot.

2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion stand side by side before the grave.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Pick up a flower and lay it on the grave.

202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plucks a flower from the ground and lays it on Astarion's grave (Note: Needs flower prop. Astarion is still kneeling down)

276.speaker: Player
276.text: That sounds very sincere. Are you sure the parasite hasn't chewed through your brain?

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: If it has, it might be for the best.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: You're not out of the woods yet - we still have the parasites to deal with.

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: Oh, I hadn't forgotten. But with you here, I am... dare I say 'optimistic' about our chances?

90.speaker: Player
90.text: The bastard got what was coming to him.

266.speaker: Astarion
266.text: It doesn't wipe away the stain he left on the world, though.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: A little stereotypical, don't you think?

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Perhaps, but some things are classics for a reason.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Are we here to piss on someone's grave?

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: The enthusiasm is appreciated, but hopefully not.

253.speaker: Astarion
253.text: You couldn't wait ten seconds before being an absolute freak?

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: Something I haven't shown anyone else.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: If you want to sneak off for a cuddle, you can just ask.

143.speaker: Astarion
143.text: I'll try to restrain myself if you do. Shall we?

138.speaker: Player
138.text: That's it? You're giving up on walking in the sun?

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: Less giving up, more reassessing what I want. What I really want.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: I thought things would feel different when he was gone. That I'd be revelling in my freedom.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: Instead I just feel... blank? I suppose not wielding the blade myself makes a difference. It's all a little anti-climactic.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Cazador took up so much room in my life - my memories of him, my need for revenge. Now there's just a blank space where he used to be.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: Maybe that's the space you need to build your own life.

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: Assuming I have a life to build. It's a little hard to plan anything knowing there's still a tadpole burrowing its way through your brain.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: Defining yourself by the worst people in your life sounds kind of messed up.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Perhaps. But it'd be worse again to pretend it never happened.

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: Of course now that I'm free from one threat, we'll have to face the other: the tadpoles that let me walk in the light.

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: Controlling them may still be an option, but it's a dangerous game.

146.speaker: Astarion
146.text: I'd live with the risk of something going wrong. Of the tadpole finding some new trick, reasserting itself, and making me a slave again.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm not sorry I killed him.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: No, I don't expect you to be. You did what you thought was right. Even if you were objectively wrong.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: So why not focus on the tadpoles? They're our biggest problem.

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: The only reason I can still walk in the day, you mean? Yes, we will have to do something about them.
